Henry and I talked for a few more minutes until I got an alert on my phone. Looking at it, I saw it was from an unknown number. I was about to disregard it when I saw what the message said:

It’s Andrea; we need to talk.
11111111111111111111111111111111111.title: At the Courthouse

111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Henry and I walked inside the courtroom; with Henry placing a hand on my shoulder as we entered. Everything seemed to be going well, so I was surprised when I felt Henry stiffen up. Looking at him, I said, “What’s going...”

All I got in response was a curt “Shh” as we kept walking. The bailiff escorted brought us into the chambers of Judge Melissa St. Marie, She stood up from her desk the moment she saw my stepfather. “Henry, I haven’t seen you in years. What brings you here?”

“I’m here regarding the Brian Hawkins case, Your Honor.”

“Ah yes, your white whale; I see you’ve stayed on it even after retiring.” Pausing, she said, “What sort of break has come your way?”

“I’ll let the boy explain, Your Honor.”

I’d never felt more nervous in my life, and I got sent to the principal's office a few times. Clearing my throat, I said, “Your Honor, I’m Brian Hawkins.”

The Judge looked at me, then the file, at me again and then the file. “You can’t be Brian Hawkins; he disappeared over six years ago when he was 13 years old. You hardly look a day over 13.” Turning to Henry, she said, “Mr. Tucker, if this is your idea of a joke I’m not amused.”

“Have you ever known me to lie, Your Honor?” handing the judge my information, he said, “Fingerprints, dental records, DNA; they all say that he’s Brian Hawkins, at the same age he was when he disappeared."

“Then where’s he been for the last 6 years?” looking at me, she said, “Why hasn’t he aged a day in that time?”

“I don’t know, Your Honor.” Sighing, I said, “I was playing hide and seek in the woods with my sister when I suddenly lost consciousness. When I woke up again I was in a hospital bed and my mother was suddenly pregnant."

“There are no clues as to what happened to him, Your Honor.” Looking at me, Henry said, “Frankly, we’ve decided not to look for any clues; if something falls in our lap then so be it, but we won’t be actively looking for it. So far as we’re concerned, Brian’s back and that’s all any of us could wish for."

“I guess there’s no sense looking this gift horse in the mouth. I suppose I can’t blame you; after all, he’s upright and above ground.” Signing some paperwork, she looked at me and said, “Your stepfather is one of the good ones, Brian. Congratulations.”

"So, that's all?" I asked.

"As far as I’m concerned your case is closed.” Smiling, the Judge said, “You’re now, once again, a 13-year-old boy who’s got school in a couple of weeks.“

Henry and I shook the judge’s hand before we left the courtroom. As we did so, I saw someone leave just ahead of us. I saw him again in the hallway, making a phone call. Henry saw him, too, and cursed under his breath.

"What is it?" I asked.

"That guy's a reporter," Henry explained, "and dollars to doughnuts, he knows exactly who you are. I'm afraid your private life won't be private anymore."
111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Meeting the Judge

1111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Henry dropped me off in front of the Rogers’ house before heading back to our house. As I walked up to the door, I couldn’t help but be a little anxious. It was hard to tell Andrea’s tone from her text, but part of me suspected that she wasn’t happy with me.

She must’ve seen me coming up the driveway because she was standing at the door when I got up there. I was beginning to notice a pattern with her; every time I’d seen Andrea she was wearing a dress or some other feminine outfit. Today was no different; she was wearing a dress that showed a fair amount of cleavage.

As she opened the door, I looked at her and said, “You wanted to talk with me?”

“Yeah, come on in.” sighing, her tone of voice neutral, Andrea said, “I’d rather not do this in public.”

More worried than ever, I followed Andrea into the living room and sat down on the couch. As she took a seat across from me, I said, “Andrea, if this is about Emily...”

“I think the best thing for you to do, for the time being, is to let me talk.” Looking at me, clearly annoyed about something, Andrea said, “What I want to hear, right now, is why I had to find out about this from my little sister.”

“Everything happened so fast, I wasn’t sure if it meant anything.” Taking a breath, as I tried to calm myself, I said, “I wasn’t going to tell you if it turned out to be nothing.”

“I’m sorry, but I don’t buy that for a minute,” getting up, Andrea walked over and sat next to me. “When I first started my transition,
I was more worried about coming out to you then I was to my family. But no matter how scared I was, I still wanted to tell you.”

“That’s not the same thing, Andrea; you were undergoing a life-altering change.” Sitting back, I said, “I’m trying to figure out my feelings for a girl.”

“Let’s talk about this girl, shall we?” sitting back, crossing her legs, Andrea looked at me and said, “You’re a pretty attractive guy; even I had a crush on you for a little bit. You could get any girl that you wanted, why would you decide to take an interest in Emily?”

Choosing to ignore the fact my best friend had a crush on me, I said, “I’ve always cared about Emily; she was like a little sister to me.” Sighing, I said, “It wasn’t until I wound up in this situation that I realized, if the conditions were right, that I could be attracted to her.”

“Okay, I get that; she’s good looking for a girl her age. But come on, you can do so much better than her.” Leaning close to me, Andrea said, “Just between you and me, she’s kind of annoying. She’s always borrowing my clothes and makeup. You could do so much better than her.”

I don’t know exactly what caused it to happen, but one minute I was listening to Andrea talk, and the next minute I snapped.
Jumping to my feet, I got right in Andrea’s face and said, “Don’t you ever say that about Emily!” unable to calm down, I said,
“She’s the most beautiful girl I’ve ever seen, and I’ll be damned if I’ll let anyone talk about her like that.”

Andrea just stared at me with a stunned look on her face. I thought she was going to call me out for yelling at her like that. Instead, to my surprise, she said, “Well that’s all I needed to hear.” Turning towards the hallway, she said, “Is that good enough for you, sis?”

My jaw dropped as I saw Emily come around the corner; a big smile on her face. “That’s good enough for me.”

I looked at both of them in shock, unable to process what was happening. “W-What’s going on here?”

Standing up, Andrea went over to stand next to Emily. “As I said, Emily told me everything; even how you weren’t sure if your feelings for her were genuine.” Smiling, Andrea said, “We concocted this little scheme to see if we could make you realize they were.”

“Y-You tricked me?” looking at Andrea, I said, “For a minute there I thought you really were annoyed that I didn’t come to you.”

“Oh that part was real; I was genuinely annoyed with you about that.” Smiling, Andrea said, “I thought we promised never to keep anything secret from each other.”

“I’m sorry for not telling you.”

“It’s no big deal; just don’t let it happen again.”

Walking over to Emily, I stopped in front of her and said, “You knew this whole time, didn’t you?”

“That your feelings for me were real?” nodding, a smile on her face, Emily said, “I knew the moment you kissed me at the ice cream parlor.”

Everything around me ground to a halt; as I stared at Emily. Before I could stop myself, I leaned over and kissed her; coming up
for air just long enough to say, “Will you be my girlfriend, Emily Rogers?”

Kissing me, Emily said, “Of course I will, Brian Hawkins.”

The two of us kissed for a few minutes until Andrea brought us back to reality. “I’m so happy for you guys, but there’s one thing that you’re both forgetting about.”

“Really?” exchanging confused looks with each other, we both said, “What?”

“The part of the relationship where the parents meet the boyfriend for the first time.”

I must’ve looked worried after that because Emily looked at me and said, “Don’t worry Brian; my parents have known you for years.”

************************


I stayed over at Emily’s for a little while longer; making out with her on the couch. As I got up to leave, Andrea stopped me just outside the door. “I’m happy for you, Brian; but I want you to know something.” Getting a stern look on her face, Andrea said, “Don’t you ever do anything to hurt Emily; or so help me, I’ll make sure you never make the same mistake twice.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Meeting with Andrea

11111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I had the house to myself after I came back from Emily’s; Mac and Mom were still at the nail salon while Henry was at the hardware store. I was still feeling really good about the way things went with Emily; I’d been back for a few days and I already had a girlfriend. While I was annoyed by how they tricked me, I had to give Emily and Andrea credit for giving me the push I needed.

I was getting hungry so I was in the kitchen microwaving a personal pizza when I heard the doorbell. Thinking that perhaps it was Emily, I walked down the hall to the front door. I lost all color in my face when I saw that it was the reporter from the courthouse. I don’t know why I did it, but I foolishly opened the door. “Can I help you?”

“Are you Brian Hawkins?”

“Yeah, that’s me.” Getting nervous, I said, “Listen, I know you’re a reporter; I’m not sure I should be talking with you.”

“Don’t worry; you’ve already given me everything I needed.” Digging a recorder from his front pocket, the man said, “I just needed you to confirm my suspicions.”

Before I could even react, the man turned and walked back down the sidewalk. All I could do, while watching him leave, was think that I’d just made a terrible mistake. Closing the door, I ran into the kitchen and grabbed the phone. Dialing Henry’s number, I waited for him to answer. “Brian?”

“Henry, you need to come home right now.”
11111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: An Unwelcome Visit

111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Henry must’ve run most of the lights getting home; because he pulled into the driveway barely 15 minutes after I hung up the phone. Running into the house, he looked at me and said, “Are you alright?”

“I’m fine; just a little shaken up is all.” Looking at Henry, I said, “Why did he come here to the house?”

“He probably wanted to confirm his suspicions before going to his editor.” Looking at me, Henry said, “From now on; don’t open the door for anyone you don’t know, and don’t answer the phone.”

I wasn’t thrilled about the new restrictions, but I understood why Henry doing it. He just wanted to make sure I was safe. “Fine, I can live with that.”

“I’ll make sure your mom and sister do the same thing.” Pausing, Henry said, “If they’re ballsy enough to come after you, they’ll probably come after them as well.”

“Why would they take such an interest in me?”

“Think about it, Brian; your disappearance was all the town could talk about for months.” Looking at me, Henry said, “Now here you are, six years later, the same age you were when you disappeared.”

The seriousness of the situation became too much for me; I leaned up against the hallway wall. “I thought being a teenager was rough enough already; now, with this, they’re never going to leave me alone.”

“We’ll get through this, Brian; so long as you watch your back.”

At that moment I felt an overwhelming urge to hug Henry. Going over, I embraced him and said, “Thanks, Henry.”

“There’s no need to thank me, Brian.” Kneeling in front of me, Henry said, “We’re family, and family looks out for each other.”

It was only then that I remembered the pizza in the microwave; it was most definitely cold by now, but I could just heat it up again. “I was about to have lunch when all this happened; you feel like joining me?”

“Sure, I could go for some lunch.” Following me down the hall, Henry said, “Perhaps you could tell me about how things went with Andrea.”
111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Henry To The Rescue

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I spent 30 minutes going over everything that happened with Andrea; and, to his credit, Henry listened the entire time. When I was finished, he said, “Does this mean you’ve made your decision regarding Emily?”

“Yeah, I guess it does; after all, we made out on her couch for close to an hour.” Smiling, I said, “So long as her parents approve, we’re going to start dating.”

“I didn’t want to say anything before, but I had a feeling things would turn out this way.”

“You did?”

“Brian, you forget that I was a detective for 12 years.” Chuckling, Henry said, “I got pretty good at reading people; and I could tell that your feelings for Emily were genuine.”

“There was never any doubt they were genuine, Henry.” Sighing, I said, “I just wasn’t sure it was appropriate for me to feel that way about her.”

“I was in your position myself once; I had a huge crush on my best friend all through 9th and 10th grade.” Leaning back, Henry said, “Her name was Maggie; and we’d known each other since we were 3 years old. We thought of each other as siblings; right up until she started puberty.”

“What happened?”

“Exactly what you think would’ve happened; she started to develop and suddenly this girl I’d known for years was becoming an attractive woman.” Pausing, Henry said, “I kept telling myself that it was wrong for me to have those feelings for her until she admitted to having the same feelings for me.”

“So what happened next?” my interested peaked, I said, “Did you guys start dating?”

“We dated for 6 years; then I proposed to her.” Sighing, looking a little emotional, Henry said, “Things were great for the first 12 years; until work started getting in the way. You know the rest, I’m afraid; we got divorced and we haven’t spoken in five years.”

I sat there for a moment; unable to process what Henry had just told me. Looking at him, I said, “Was the point of that story to scare me off of dating Emily?”

“I guess what I was trying to say is that it’s normal to develop feelings for your friends.” looking at me, Henry said, “I’m not saying what happened to me will happen to you; but, if I can give you one piece of advice – it’s not to take Emily for granted.”

“Don’t worry, Henry; I’ll never take her for granted.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Man To Man Talk

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Dinner that night was more serious than the previous night; primarily because of my encounter with the reporter. That wasn’t to say we didn’t have cause to celebrate; after all, I was now legally alive again. Henry told Mom and Mac about the precautions he wanted us all to take for the near future; Mac balked a bit but she agreed.

*************************


We were all pretty tired so everyone was in bed by 8:30; although I was having trouble falling asleep. I couldn’t stop thinking about Emily and I honestly wondered if she was thinking about me.

It was just after 9:15 when I heard a noise coming from the outside my room. My sense of curiosity got the better of me, so I climbed out of bed and went to investigate. I followed the noise to Mac’s bedroom door; I slowly opened the door and notice Mac’s window was wide open.

Upon further examination I realized that Mac wasn’t in the room, so I ran to the window; just in time to see her running around the far corner of the house. What the hell is she doing? Going back to my room, I quickly got dressed so I could follow her.

I know I should’ve told Mom and Henry, but at that moment I decided not to. Going downstairs, I went outside to see if I could find her. Running to the end of the driveway, I caught sight of her a short distance down the road.

I followed after her; the whole time wondering what she was doing. After walking for about 15 minutes, she turned up a nearby street. I ran to catch up to her; watching from a distance as she approached a brightly lit house with about a dozen cars parked out front.

As I got closer, I started to suspect this was a teen party; my suspicions were soon proven correct when I spotted three girls sitting on the hood of some guy’s car with beers in their hands. Mac, please don’t be doing what I think you’re doing.

I made my way past some drunken teens, who barely acknowledged me. Walking into the house, I could hear Mac’s voice coming from the kitchen. There was some loud music but I could still make out what she was saying, “Thanks for inviting me, guys; I’ve been looking forward to this all week,”

Going towards the kitchen, I stopped in my tracks when I saw what was going on in there. I kept trying to tell myself I was imagining things; but sadly I wasn’t. There she was, my little sister, wearing the kind of skimpy outfit you’d find college girls wearing at spring break. On top of that, she had an open bottle of beer in her hands.

Unable to control myself, I walked over and smacked the bottle out of her hands. Looking at me, daggers in her eyes, Mac said,
“What the hell, Brian!?”

“I should be asking you the same thing, Mac.” Trying to stay calm, I said, “What the hell are you doing here?”

Before Mac could answer, the sound of police sirens could be heard coming from the front yard. Oh crap.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: That Night

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
My second time inside a police station wasn’t at all like my first. The officers, this time around, were scowling at me whenever I asked them for anything. Mac was of no help at all; she just sat there without saying a word.

If I had any doubt the police were unhappy with us, Henry left doubt when he entered the station. He was glaring at us the moment he walked in. The officer who’d picked us up walked over to him and said, “We haven’t done anything with them yet; we figured we’d let you decide.”

Henry walked over to us; and as he got closer, I realized that he wasn’t glaring at both of us – instead he was just glaring at me. “Do you mind explaining what the hell you were thinking?” looking at me, fuming, Henry said, “My God, were you this much trouble before you disappeared? After everything your sister’s done to overcome her problems, I can’t believe you’d drag her along.”

Looking up at both of us, Mac said, “Stop.”

“Do you hear that?” gesturing to Mac, Henry said, “Your sister’s asking you to stop. Do you think you can...”

Mac interjected again; this time louder than before, “No Henry, I’m telling you to stop."

That wasn’t at all what Henry expected. “Me?”

“This isn’t Brian’s fault; it’s mine. My problems never went away; I just got better at hiding them.” Gesturing to me, Mac said,
“Brian was just following me to see what I was up to.”

Sitting down between us, Henry said, “All this time?"

“I-I’ve been getting drunk regularly for years; I-I don’t remember what it’s like to be sober.” Tearing up, Mac said, “D-Do whatever you want to me because I deserve it; just don’t blame Brian.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: At the Station

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Thanks to some favors that Henry was able to call in; Mac and I were only slapped with warnings. I was grounded until school started, while Mac was quickly put into a month-long rehab program.

Allison and Emily came along for the ride as emotional support. Emily was understandably pissed at me for not telling her sooner, but she quickly realized she was as much to blame as me. Emily and I sat in the back of the car for the ride up; if Mac thought that was strange, she didn’t say anything about it.

Mac was listening to some music on her phone, so Emily and I were free to talk. Resting against me, Emily said, “If I know you, then you’re probably blaming yourself for this.”

“How could I not, Em?” looking at her, I said, “All this happened because I disappeared.”

“It’s not like you planned to disappear for six years; you can’t blame yourself for something you had no control over.” Sighing, Emily looked at me and said, “Besides, if you hadn’t disappeared; then we certainly wouldn’t have gotten together.”

“I guess you’re right.” Taking Emily’s hand, I said, “Besides, if I hadn’t disappeared; I probably would’ve ended up with your sister.”

“Well, you could definitely do worse than her.”

Leaning over the back seat, Allison said, “So you two are really serious about this whole dating thing, aren’t you?”

“Yeah, I guess we are.” Smiling, I looked at Allison said, “I guess that means you’re out of luck.”

“Don’t take this the wrong way, but you’re not my type.” Chuckling, Allison said, “I was only flirting with you to mess with Emily.”

“Even if it was only in jest, it felt nice to have two attractive girls take an interest in me.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Drive to Rehab

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
A noticed a doctor and two attendants waiting for us as we arrived at the facility. If they were at all shocked by the sight of a 13-year-old being dropped at rehab, they didn’t show it. There was still time before she had to check-in; so, after getting out of the car, we all went to give Mac a farewell hug.

I went first; looking at her, I said, “This must seem weird; saying goodbye to me so soon after I got back.”

“It’s only for a month, Brian.” With a chuckle, Mac said, “That’s nothing compared to the last time.”

Mom and Henry were next; it surprised no one that Mom started crying. While Emily and Allison tended to Mom, Henry said,
“We’ll all come to visit every week; and don’t worry; Brian’s grounding will be lifted for the visits.”

“I would’ve asked you to do that anyway.” Sighing, Mac said, “Please don’t be too hard on him; I made him promise not to tell you.”

Once the well-wishes had been taken care of, Mac picked up her things and approached the doctor. “Hi, my name’s Mackenzie and I’m alcoholic.” Looking back at us briefly, she said, “Can you please help me? Because I don’t think I can do it on my own.”

“We’ll do everything we can to help you, Mackenzie.” With a smile, the doctor directed one of the attendants to take Mac’s suitcase. After that, she said, “Let's get you checked in."

Once Mac was inside, Henry drove us back. After we dropped off Emily and Allison, we came back home, and my grounding began. For the rest of the day, not only was I not allowed out of the house, I wasn't even allowed visitors. It wasn't that bad of punishment from my perspective since it let me spend more time with Mom and Henry.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Dropping Mac Off

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I was two days into my punishment; and I have to say it’s not as bad as I’d hoped. Of course it helped that there was rain in the forecast for the next four days; so it wasn’t like I was missing anything outside.

I spent most of my time reading or catching up on 6 years of TV. But, most importantly, it gave me time to think; mostly about my new relationship with Emily. Don’t get me wrong, I was thrilled by the thought that we were dating; but there were times when I still felt weird about our relationship.

Both Mom and Henry told me that such thoughts were normal at the start of any relationship; especially one between two people who’ve known each other for years. Speaking of Emily, I was in the middle of watching an episode of Grey’s Anatomy when there was a knock at my door.

Thinking that it was Mom, or Henry, checking up on me; I went to open the door. Seeing how I wasn’t supposed to be allowed visitors, you could imagine my surprise when I saw Emily standing outside my door. “Em? W-What are you doing here?”

“I thought I’d stop by and see how you were doing.” Stepping inside, Emily kissed me and said, “Perhaps have a conjugal visit with my boyfriend.”

While the prospect of getting to second base with Emily was appealing, I didn’t think now would be an appropriate time. “That sounds great; but I’m not supposed to have any visitors while I’m grounded.” Stepping back, I said, “What are you doing here?”

“My parents want to have a chat with you; about us.” Sighing, Emily said, “Your folks said it would be alright.”

The moment I’d been dreading since we started dating had finally come; I was going to see Emily’s parents. But it wasn’t as a neighbor, and long-time family friend; no, this time it would be as the boy dating their youngest daughter. Looking at Emily, I said,
“Is there anything I should know about before I go over there?”

“Well this is the first they’ve seen you since you came back, so be prepared for the ‘where have you been’ and ‘why haven’t you aged’ questions.” Pausing, Emily said, “Other than that, I’m not 100%; I wasn’t even home when they met with Collin about his relationship with Andrea.”

“Why do I have a sinking feeling that they won’t be alright with this.”

“Why wouldn’t they? They’ve known you for years; and it’s not like we ever did anything before you disappeared.” Kissing me, Emily said, “Brian, you’re getting worked up over nothing.”

“That’s easy for you to say; it’s less of a problem when the girl meets the boyfriend’s parents.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Few Days Later

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Emily wasn’t exaggerating when she said her parents would have questions for me; they asked more questions than the police and judge combined. I suppose it was only fair; after all, they knew me while the others didn’t.

Once those questions were out of the way, things turned serious as the topic changed to my relationship with Emily. “We’ve known you most of your life, Brian; so please understand that we’re not out to get you.” Looking at me, Mr. Rogers said, “But you can understand where we might be concerned about your relationship with our daughter; after all as far as you’re concerned, she was 7 years old only a few days ago.”

“I assure you, Mr. Rogers; any feelings I have for your daughter only came about after I came back.” Sighing, I said, “I promise you that I never did anything inappropriate with her as a child.”

“That was never a concern of ours; but it’s a relief to hear you say that.” Leaning back in his chair, Mr. Rogers looked at me and said, “What does concern us, however, is how teenagers act when they’re in love.”

I knew what they were referring to; but that was the last thing on my mind. While I did care deeply for Emily, I knew we were years away from sleeping together. I figured the most we’d probably do was that we’d get physical from the waist up. “I promise you, sir; Emily and I will not be having sex with each other.” Taking a breath, I said, “I’ve gotten a second chance at life, for whatever reason; I’m not going to waste it by becoming a teenage father.”

“Still, I think it’s only fair that there be some ground rules.” Turning to Mrs. Rogers, he said, “What do you think, honey?”

“I agree completely; there should be ground rules.” Looking at me, Mrs. Rogers said, “Chief among them; you and Emily aren’t to be alone with each other. There will always be someone around to ensure that you two do nothing more than kissing.”

I caught a glimpse of Emily poking her head around the corner. She waved at me, but I didn’t respond. Turning back to Mrs. Rogers, I said, “Yes ma’am.”

“So long as you can abide by our rules, we’ll give you permission to date our daughter.” Standing up, Mr. Rogers said, “To tell you the truth; I’d much rather let her date you than someone from school that we didn’t know.”

“Thank you, Mr. & Mrs. Rogers.” Standing up, I said, “Before I leave, I’ll never let any harm come to Emily.”

After saying my goodbyes, I left and started walking back towards my house. Before I could cross over to my yard, I heard footsteps behind me. Looking back, I saw Emily walking towards me. Coming over, she kissed me and said, “See, I told you they wouldn’t have a problem with us.”

“I should listen to you more often.” Kissing her, I said, “I suppose the next thing to do would be to tell Mac about us.”

“Let’s give her some time to get better; then we’ll drop that bombshell.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Meeting the Parents

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I was grateful for the fact that my punishment didn’t prevent me from playing video games or watching movies. I was up in my room playing a copy of Halo 5 that I’d borrowed from Cameron; the whole time thinking that the game wasn’t as good as the original trilogy.

I was in the middle of playing one of the levels when there was a knock at my door. After pausing the game, I went to answer it; only to find Mom standing at the door with a worried look on her face. “What’s wrong?” jumping to conclusions, I said, “Is something wrong with Mac?”

“Your sister’s fine, as far as I know.” Sighing, Mom said, “There’s something on the news; Henry thought you should see.”

Wondering what could possibly be on the news that I’d find interesting, I walked downstairs with Mom. The two of us walked into the family room just in time to see a picture of me flash across the screen. A disembodied voice said, “Everyone remembers six years ago when Brian Hawkins disappeared without a trace. The entire town spent months searching for him without success.”

Another image came on the screen; this time of Henry and me leaving the courthouse. “A reporter from the Daily Journal snapped this photo two days ago; in it, you can see someone who bears a remarkable resemblance to the missing Brian Hawkins. Forensic analysts have examined the image, comparing it to one from six years ago; and have come to the inexplicable conclusion that the boy leaving the courthouse was Brian Hawkins,”

I felt all color drain from my face; as I looked from the TV to Mom and Henry in disbelief. “What’s going to happen now?”

“I don’t know; but I can tell you this, it won’t be fun.”

“As if the analysis wasn’t good enough; the same reporter paid a visit to the Hawkins’ residence, where he recorded the boy confirming that he was Brian Hawkins. All this begs the question; where was he for the last six years, and why hasn’t he aged at all.”

Collapsing on the couch, I said, “I-I don’t feel so good.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Troubling News

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I sat on the couch for what felt like an eternity; as waves of nausea rolled over me. While Mom went to get me something to settle my stomach, Henry sat down next to me. “It’s going to be alright, Brian.” Looking at me, trying his best to be supportive, Henry said, “Just like Mac with her drinking, you’ll get through this.”

“This is completely different from Mac’s situation, Henry.” Sighing, I said, “I disappeared for six years; people aren’t going to leave me alone now.”

The doorbell rang, as if on cue, as Mom walked back into the room with a can of ginger ale. Handing me the can, she went towards the door, “I wonder who that could be?”

I started to panic; believing that it was going to be some reporter. But I quickly realized it was all for naught, when I heard Emily’s voice. “Mrs. Tucker, I know Brian’s not allowed to have visitors but...”

“It’s alright, Emily; you can come in.” stepping aside, Mom said, “He’s in the family room with Henry.”

Hearing hurried footsteps, I got up as Emily rushed into the room. After she kissed me, I caught my breath and said, “Em, what are you doing here?”

“I came over as soon as my dad told me about the news story.” Kissing me again, Emily said, “What kind of girlfriend would I be if I didn’t give you emotional support?”

“I appreciate the concern, Em; but I don’t want you involved in this.” Sitting back down, I said, “It's bad enough I’m in their sights, I don’t want them hounding you for information.”

“Don’t worry about me, I’ll be fine.” Sitting next to me, holding my hands in hers, Emily said, “I’ll be here for you until the end, alright?”

I’ll admit to being genuinely touched by Emily’s actions; she was willing to put herself in harm’s way just to look out for me. Without saying a word, I leaned forward and kissed Emily on the lips; which she reciprocated until, not long after, we were kissing on the couch.

Standing behind me, having watched the whole thing, Henry said, “We’ll, uh, give you two some space; but then we need to discuss what to do next.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Emily's Support

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Henry and Mom kept their promise; letting Emily and I have 20 minutes alone before they came back into the room. I know it sounds cliché, but that was the best 20 minutes of my life; my relationship with Emily was still new, but I thoroughly enjoyed the kissing.

As they took seats across from us, Henry said, “I know it’s not ideal, Brian; but until things die down, I don’t want you going anywhere alone.” Sighing, Henry said, “If the reporters are ballsy enough to come here, there’s nothing to stop them from approaching you at school or anywhere else.”

“Don’t worry, Mr. Tucker; with Allison, Cameron, and me around, he won’t be alone at school.”

“That’s good to hear, Emily.” Pausing, Henry said, “When you’re here at home, I don’t want you answering the phone at all. Even if the Caller ID says it’s me or your mother, don’t answer it; people can spoof phone numbers these days. If it’s me or your mother, we’ll leave a message for you to call us back.”

While I wasn’t thrilled by the restrictions being placed on me, I knew they were for the best. Casting a glance at Emily, I looked back at Henry and said, “What about keeping Emily safe?” pausing, I said, “If they find out that we’re dating, they’ll come after her as well.”

“I’ll have a chat with her parents tomorrow; as well as if Carrie and Collin’s folks.” Sighing, Henry said, “Right now, it’s safe to assume that anyone who knew you six years ago is fair game.”

I came to a sudden realization at that point. “What about Mac? Should we tell her?”

“She’s in rehab, Brian; no one can visit her without permission from the doctors or me and your mother.” Pausing, Henry said, “As strange as it may sound, given her situation, your sister is the safest one of all.”

So that’s how the conversation continued for 10 minutes; before Emily decided that it was time to leave. After she left, I wasn’t really in the mood for anything; so I went upstairs to go to bed.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Making a Plan

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The next couple of days passed by without any incidents; no encounters with reporters nor were there any strange phone calls. But that didn’t mean today wasn’t going to be stress-free – after all, it was the first day of school. I was certain that I’d get a lot of confused looks at school; but with the help of Cameron, Emily and Allison I knew I wouldn’t have a problem.

You’re probably wondering what happened with my planned date (no, not that kind of date) with Andrea – the one where we’d hang out and play video games all day. Well if my being grounded hadn’t kept that from happening, then I’m sure Collin’s surprise weekend getaway would have. I couldn’t blame Andrea for bailing on me; after all, it’s not every day a college freshman can afford to take his girlfriend to a luxury spa for the weekend.

Anyway, back to the first day of school. Henry dropped me and Emily off by the main entrance if only to ensure that we got there safely. After saying goodbye to him, the two of us got out and met Allison and Cameron in front of the flag pole.

As we walked up to them, I noticed Allison looking at us holding hands. Remembering how she was flirting with me at the pool, I said, “I hope there are no hard feelings, Allison; but, uh, Emily and I...have a history.”

“Don’t worry, Brian; I figured it was only a matter of time before you two got together.” Chuckling, Allison said, “Besides, I was only flirting with you to mess with Emily.”

While Emily glared at Allison, I couldn’t help but feel disappointed – this whole time, I thought Allison was actually interested in me. “Oh, I see.”

Allison quickly realized her mistake; looking at me, she said, “I didn’t mean it like that, Brian; you’re actually quite good looking.” Blushing, she said, “It’s just, you’re not really my type.”

As we started walking into the building, Emily leaned over and said, “If you were her type, then we’d have a problem; because she goes for the jocks.” Kissing my cheek, Emily said, “I’ve always had a thing for the quite, smart type.”

Before we got into the building, I said, “Just one thing before we go inside; Henry managed to keep Mac’s name out of the paper regarding her arrest.” Pausing, I said, “If anyone asks where she is, we’re supposed to say she’s home with mono.”

“That’s probably a good idea.” Looking around at some of the girls nearby, Allison said, “There are kids here who’d jump at the news that Mac’s an alcoholic.”

Looking at me, Cameron said, “How’s she doing, by the way?”

“She’s being stubborn; yesterday they called and said she broke a nurse’s thumb in a door.” Sighing, I said, “Apparently she wasn’t exaggerating when she said she doesn’t remember what it’s like to be sober; because the doctor in charge of her case said she’s rarely seen adults go through withdrawals this bad.”

“W-Would it be alright if I came up with you guys the next time you see her?” turning quiet, Cameron said, “I-I want her to know that I’m here for her.”

“Sure, I don’t see why not.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The First Day of School

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
My first class of the day was Gym; and I was dreading it. It wasn’t because I wasn’t the athletic type; it was because I was worried about not being around my friends. I noticed some boys looking at me in the locker room, talking to each other in hushed tones. They must’ve realized that I was the boy from the news.

I ignored the whispering and went out to the gymnasium. My earlier concerns were proven fruitless when I saw Allison sitting on the bleachers nearby. Once she saw me standing there, she smiled and waved me over. As I walked over and took a seat next to her, I said, “At least there’ll be one friendly face in this class.” Sighing, I said, “A lot of the guys were talking about me in the locker room.”

“I can’t say I blame them; after all, your sudden return is pretty unusual.” Looking at me, Allison said, “I wasn’t supposed to tell you this, but you’ll find out soon enough. Your mom and Henry made arrangements with the school to have Emily, Cameron, or myself in at least one of your classes.”

I was touched by the thoughtful gesture. As more students started to trickle in, I noticed several girls walking towards us. I couldn’t help but notice the looks on their faces as they saw me sitting with Allison. One of them, a blonde who was surprisingly well developed for a 13-year-old, looked at me and said, “So Allison, I heard your dear leader is in rehab.”

If the ‘dear leader’ remark wasn’t enough; the instant the girl mentioned rehab, I knew she was talking about Mac. I let my emotions get the best of me and, before Allison could stop me, I was right in the girl's face. “What did you say?”

“Ugh, go away loser.” Shoving me, the girl said, “This doesn’t concern you.”

“Megan, this is Mac’s brother – the one who’d been missing for six years.” Getting right in the girl’s face, her tone and demeanor changing, Allison said, “Now if you don’t want your little secret to get out, I suggest you keep your mouth shut for a change.”

Megan huffed for a moment before walking away; the two other girls glaring at us before they joined her. As Allison sat down again, thrown off by her sudden change in attitude, I said, “I, uh, wow...that was something,”

“Sorry about that; sometimes my inner bitch comes out without warning.”

Growing concerned, I looked at her and said, “Does that happen to Emily too?”

“It happens to every girl, Brian; especially during our time of the month or when someone just pisses us off.” Turning to me, Allison said, “Word of warning, don’t annoy Emily during her time of the month. You won’t like what happens next.”

I sat back on the bleachers for a moment; trying to process the idea that Emily, my girlfriend, could have a dark side I didn’t know about. Since coming back, and learning about her problems, I’d assumed Mac’s dark side was because of the drinking – but now, I wondered if the drinking just made it more noticeable. Turning my attention to Allison, I said, “How could Megan have heard about Mac being in rehab?”

“Who knows; that girl has ways to find things out.” Looking at me, Allison said, “Don’t worry though; she won’t say anything if she knows what’s good for her.”

I suddenly remembered Allison’s veiled threat to Megan. “That reminds me; what exactly is her little secret?”

“It’s more of an open secret; since every girl in our grade knows about it.” Leaning towards me, whispering in my ear, Allison said, “Megan’s stuffed her bra since the 7th grade; she’s pretty flat-chested.”

A grin formed on my face; I suspected something was off about Megan’s chest. There was no way a 13-year-old girl could be that big this early. Looking at Allison, I said, “Don’t worry, I won’t tell anyone.”

“Good.” Getting up, Allison said, “Now come on; class is about to start.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: My First Class

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Gym class was okay, I had a lot of people staring at me, but thankfully Allison was there for moral support. The same couldn’t be said for my second class, math; I was on my own for that one. Thankfully no one seemed too interested in me, so it was smooth sailing till lunchtime.

Walking into the lunchroom, I saw a long line of people waiting for food. I groaned; because I figured the food hadn’t improved much in 6 years. After getting my food, I spotted Emily and Allison sitting at a table in the corner. I didn’t see Cameron but I figured he was around somewhere.

Making my way over to the table, I put my tray down and went to kiss Emily. You can probably imagine how surprised I was when she not only recoiled but also pushed me away. “Don’t do that here, Brian; everyone’s watching.”

“So what; who cares if they see me kissing my girlfriend.”

I leaned in for another kiss, this time Emily shoved me hard enough for me to land on the floor. Stepping up to me, she said, “Get away from me, loser.”

I had no idea what was going on at this point; Emily hadn’t acted remotely like this when Mac found us together. Getting to my feet, desperate for answers, I said, “Em, what’s going on?”

“Just stay away from me, Brian; I want nothing to do with you.”

At this point I was fairly certain that my relationship with Emily was over; so without saying a word, I turned and walked out of the cafeteria. I found a secluded stairwell and sat down to cry. I was there for a few minutes until I heard footsteps approaching, I looked behind me and saw Emily standing in the doorway. Wiping tears from my eyes, I said, “You come to yell at me some more?”

“No Brian, I-I’m...”

Emily stopped mid-sentence as she walked over a planted a kiss on my lips. I reciprocated briefly until I remembered what happened only minutes ago. Breaking the kiss, I shoved Emily away and said, “No Em, kissing me won’t make up for what you did back there.”

Looking wounded, Emily said, “Brian, let me explain.”

“It better be one hell of an explanation; because until now I thought you were my girlfriend.” Looking at her, angry, I said, “If this is how you treat your boyfriends then I hate to break it to you, but you won’t have many of them.”

I could tell that Emily was trying to figure a way out of the hole she’d dug for herself; I could practically see the gears turning in her head. After a moment, she looked at me and said, “Will you just shut up for one second!” with a hint of emotion in her voice, tears beginning to form, Emily, said, “I am your girlfriend, Brian; but...it’s complicated.”

Before today I’d never guffawed in my life, but I did so now in response to Emily’s statement. “How could it possibly be complicated? It seems pretty clear cut to me; we’re either a couple or we’re not.”

“There’s more to school then just grades, Brian; I’ve worked hard to become one of the most popular girls in our class.” Sighing, clearly dreading what she was about to say, Emily, said, “I love you, but being your girlfriend isn’t helping my status any.”

I felt the same way I did when I found out my dad had died; like someone had punched me in the stomach. “Well then, I’ll make it easier for you.” Shoving her as I walked by, I said, “We’re through, you’re not my girlfriend anymore.”

I swear I could hear Emily collapsing against the stairwell wall as I left; but at that moment, I didn’t care. All I could think about, as I walked through the halls, was how conflicted I had been when we first got together; how I tried to convince myself it was wrong to feel that way about her – but I got past that. If Emily truly loved me, then it shouldn’t matter what our classmates thought about our relationship.

However, as I walked into the bathroom to compose myself, I couldn’t shake the feeling that I’d made a terrible mistake.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Lunchtime Troubles

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I wasn’t in a very good mood after what happened with Emily; and having her in my next class didn’t help. She tried talking to me before class started but I ignored her until she got the hint and walked away.

My 4th class of the day was study hall; so after attendance was taken I made my way to the library. With nothing to do but sit at the computer, I decided to see what information there was about my disappearance on the web.

It turned out that Henry and the others were right; there were tons of wild conspiracy theories about my disappearance. Now that I was back there were theories about that as well; some people thought I was a clone while some thought I was from another reality. One of the more mainstream, yet still factually incorrect, theories was that my family had hidden me in the basement for the last 6 years.

************************************


My last class of the day was one I’d been looking forward to – science. My mood improved immensely when I walked into the classroom and saw Cameron sitting at one of the tables. As I walked over and took a seat next to him, he said, “I heard about what happened at lunch with you and Emily.”

“I guess word travels fast around here.”

“It’s not every day someone like us calls someone like Emily his girlfriend in front of 200 students.”

Oh great, he’s bought into that us vs. them mentality. “It’s not like I was lying or anything; Emily is...rather she was my girlfriend.” Suddenly I remembered that Cameron had been nowhere to be seen at lunch. “That reminds me, where were you?”

“I was meeting some buddies of mine in the library; we were playing some Magic the Gathering.” Looking at me, as more people started entering the room, Cameron said, “Do you think you’ll work things out with Emily?”

“I don’t know man.” Sighing, I said, “She’s not the girl I thought she was; she’s more worried about her social status than anything else. I don’t think I can date someone like that.”

“I’m sure you’ll find a way to work things out; after all, you two do have a history together.”

It was starting again; people giving me weird looks. Turning to Cameron, in a hushed tone, I said, “Please stop talking like that; you make it sound like Emily and I were dating before I disappeared.”

“That’s not what I meant; I was referring to the fact that you two have known each other for years.”

I wanted to say something in response, but at that moment the teacher walked into the room. I figured class was about to start, so I turned to Cameron and said, “We’ll talk about this later.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Rest of the Day

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As school let out for the day, I grabbed some things from my locker and went outside to wait for my mom. While waiting by the parking lot I noticed Emily walking towards me with Cameron and Allison. I had hoped to patch things up with Emily, but the looks she was giving me told me that wasn’t going to happen.

For her part, Allison stepped up and said, “Are you two really going to break up because of what happened at lunch?” looking at us both, she said, “I’ve seen how good you are together, it’s clear the two of you are meant to be a couple.”

“I wish I agreed with you, Allison; but I don’t.” sighing, glancing at Emily, I said, “I can’t be with someone more concerned about her social life than her boyfriend.”

Emily looked as though she was going to yell at me; until she caught herself and said, “And I can’t be with someone who won’t support me.”

“What’s there to be supportive of?” incredulous, I said, “There’s more to life than being popular, Em; the sooner you realize that the better.”

I felt bad for Allison and Cameron, as they were caught in the middle of mine and Emily’s fight. I honestly expected them to side with Emily; solely because of the fact they knew her longer than me. So I was pleasantly surprised when Allison took the middle ground. “Why don’t you guys take some time to think things over, it’s never good to make decisions based on anger.” Looking at the two of us, gesturing to Cameron, she said, “We’ll support you guys in whatever you decide; just please don’t make any rash decisions.”

My mom drove up at that point, along with Allison and Cameron’s mom behind her. As I climbed into the front seat, I saw that Emily was still standing on the sidewalk. “Are you coming or not?”

“You guys go.” Shaking her head, Emily said, “I’m going to walk home; it’s only a mile and I could use the time to think.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: After School

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It was 5:30 when I entered the kitchen; Henry and Mom were already sitting at the kitchen table, waiting for me to take a seat before they called the Rehab Center. While we waited for them to answer, Henry looked at me and said, “I couldn’t help but notice you’ve been in a particular dour mood today. Did something happen at school today?”

“Yeah, something happened at school.” Sighing, I said, “Emily and I got into an argument at lunch; then we broke up.”

Mom already heard it all during the car ride home, but she still gasped when she heard me say it just now. Looking at me, Henry said, “That must’ve been a pretty big argument; what was it about?”

“It was at lunch, I walked over to where Emily and Allison were sitting; I went to give Emily a kiss but she recoiled and shoved me to the floor.” Leaning back in the chair, sighing, I said, “Come to find out, she’s more concerned about her image than her boyfriend’s feelings.”

“Emily’s at a difficult age, Brian; she’s trying to figure out where she fits in.” taking a breath, Henry said, “Part of that is because of your sister; whatever Mac did, Allison and Emily would emulate.”

As I sat there soaking in what Henry had just said, as horrible as it may sound, I found myself blaming Mac for my relationship problems with Emily. Ever since they were kids Mac had been, for lack of a better word, the Alpha in their friendship; and it seemed to still be the case six years later. “What do you suggest I do, Henry?” Looking at Henry, I said, “Despite what happened today, I still care about Emily. There has to be something I can do to fix things with her.”

“The best advice I can give you is to give Emily her space; perhaps, given time, she’ll realize her feelings for you are more important than her social status at school.”

Mom had stepped out into the hall at some point during our conversation; she walked back in and said, “I’m on hold; they’re going to get Mackenzie.”

Upon hearing that all concern I had about Emily faded away; as my thoughts turned to Mac. I knew it had only been a week since we dropped her off, but I hoped against hope that Mac was doing better. Sadly that hope vanished when her voice, seething with anger, came over the speaker. “What the hell do you guys want?”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: That Night

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Ever since I’d learned about Mac’s aggressive behavior at the Clinic, I found myself hoping that it was just an anomaly, that she was just going through withdrawals. After listening to her screaming over the phone for five minutes those hopes were dashed; as she bombarded us all with an expletive-filled tirade.

“You f**king bastards are going to pay for this; I’ll f**king kill you if I ever get out of here.”

It went on like that for a while; as she ranted about how the staff was torturing her. The worst part, for me at least, was when she said, “This is all Brian’s fault; this wouldn’t have happened if he hadn’t disappeared.”

I’d be lying if I said that didn’t wound me; all I could do was gasp in shock at Mac’s remarks. Taking one look at me, Henry turned to the phone and said, “Your brother’s disappearance has nothing to do with this, young lady; so don’t go blaming him.”

“Whatever Henry; you’re not even my real father, so stop acting like it.”

I’d had about enough at that point; I got up from the table as Mom took her turn yelling at Mackenzie. After losing my girlfriend, I didn’t need to hear that Mac blamed me for her problems.

Walking upstairs, as the screaming continued in the background, I went down the hall to my room and closed the door. That muffled the screaming a little bit, but I could still hear it in the distance.

As I sat down on my bed, I spotted a box sitting on the floor by my desk. The box contained some home movies that I’d found in the attic a few days earlier. Getting up, I grabbed the first DVD I saw and put it in the player. I didn’t even know what was on the disc until the video started; as Mac and Emily ran through the family room dressed in cowboy outfits.

I chuckled; realizing this was the last Halloween before I disappeared. Back before things went to hell. Dad must’ve been behind the camera because I saw Mom chasing after Mac so she could adjust her hat. “Hold still Mackenzie!”

Suddenly my voice came over the speakers; “Eric wants everyone to promise they won’t make fun of him because of his costume.”

Mom looked up at the camera before looking offscreen, “We promise, sweetie.”

With that the video moved to the staircase where Andrea and I stood, in all our 12-year-old glory, wearing our costumes. The Avengers had just come out a few months earlier; so I wasn’t surprised to see that Andrea and I were dressed as characters from the movie – myself as Iron Man and Andrea as the Black Widow.

I paused the video at that point; moving closer to get a better look at Andrea. In retrospect, I suppose it was obvious, even back then that something was different about Andrea. She’d always insisted on dressing as female characters for Halloween; but she went all out for this particular year, buying some fake breasts and a corset to give herself a figure. Add that to the form-fitting costume she was wearing, she easily passed for a girl.

I’m glad you were able to become your true self, Andrea.
****************************


I spent the next 30 minutes watching more of the home movies; taking note of how different Emily and Mac were from 6 years earlier. They were far from the rambunctious, and energetic, kids that I remembered them as. My sister had developed a drinking problem; while Emily was obsessed with her popularity.

At that moment I heard a knock on the door, followed by Mom slowly walking into the room. Pausing the movies once more, I looked at her and said, “I take it you finally had enough of Mac’s yelling?”

“Your sister’s problem is more severe than we thought; it’s been a week since we dropped her off, and she’s still experiencing withdrawal symptoms.” Sighing, as she took a seat next to me, Mom said, “She attacked another nurse yesterday; they’re thinking of sending her to a more secure facility.”

Hearing that got me thinking about what Mac had said earlier. “None of this would have happened if I hadn’t disappeared.” Lying back on my bed, I said, “This whole thing is my fault.”

“You can’t blame yourself for this, Brian; your sister is solely responsible for her situation.”

“Come on Mom; if I hadn’t disappeared then she wouldn’t have started drinking.” Sighing, I said, “Maybe I could’ve kept Emily from turning out the way that she did.”

“Teenage girls can be very unpredictable, Brian; especially when they’re Emily’s age.” Looking at me, Mom said, “If it makes you feel better, I have faith that you’ll work things out.”

“I love your optimism, mom; but you weren’t there.” Staring at the ceiling, I said, “We both said things in the heat of the moment, things we can’t take back.”

“I hate to break it to you, Brian; but that’s all part of being in a relationship.” Leaning up against my wall, Mom said, “Do you think Henry and I get along 24/7? About a week before you came back, I yelled at him solely because he didn’t put the mouthwash cap on tight enough.”

“Are you sure that wasn’t just some pregnancy mood swing, Mom?”

“Maybe it was, but my point still stands.” Sighing, Mom said, “Just because two people are in love doesn’t mean they won’t get angry from time to time.”

Climbing out of bed, I turned to face Mom. “Emily and I weren’t in love, Mom; we were only together for a week.”

“During that week I saw how the two of you were with each other.” Looking at me, with a ‘mother knows best’ look on her face, Mom said, “Tell me this; if you two weren’t in love, then why are you so upset over the fact that you two broke up?”

As I stood there, I started to realize that perhaps Mom was right. “Okay, let’s say you’re right about Emily and me.” Sitting next to her, I said, “How could we have possibly fallen in love so quickly?”

“It may not have always been love between you two, but you’ve both cared deeply for each other for a long time. How often do you see a 12-year-old boy willing to spend so much time with his best friend’s 7-year-old sister?” looking at me, Mom said, “Now that the age difference is no longer a factor, your feelings for each other took the next logical step.”

I was silent for a moment as I processed everything. “What do I need to do to get her back, Mom?”

“I’m afraid this is something that Emily has to figure out for herself, Brian; is her love for you more important than how your classmates feel about her?”

“I suppose I should just give her some space.”

“That’s a good idea.” Smiling, Mom said, “I’ll tell you what; it’s been 6 years since we had one of our mother/son outings. What do you say we have one tomorrow?”

After Dad’s diagnosis, Mom set aside time to spend with Mac and me individually. We did things like bike riding, rock climbing, etc. I knew Mom couldn’t do any of that stuff at the moment, but I couldn’t resist the temptation. “How do you feel about going to the indoor rock wall?”

“I’m afraid not, kiddo; I doubt they’d let me in my current condition.” Smiling, Mom said, “What do you say we visit your father’s grave, then we can decide from there.”

I'd been back for almost 2 weeks, but I hadn't seen my dad's grave yet. I suppose, in retrospect, I was just nervous about seeing it. Looking at Mom, I said, “Okay, that sounds nice.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Memory Lane

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
That night I dreamt that I was back in the woods playing hide and seek with Mac. I was kneeling behind the rock outcropping as I watched Mac searching for me in the distance. Everything seems normal here.

Everything changed suddenly when I noticed a bright light appear behind me; turning around I saw what appeared to be a portal of shimmering light floating just above the ground. Okay, I don’t remember that.

Looking over my shoulder to see that Mac had disappeared behind a boulder, I turned my attention back to the portal. I felt this overwhelming urge to reach out and touch it; so that’s what I did. Everything seemed fine until I realized I couldn’t pull my hand back. What the hell?

To make matters worse, some unseen force was starting to pull me towards the portal. “Help! Somebody, please help me!”

My pleas were unanswered; if Mac heard them, she was too far away to do anything. I struggled in vain to escape but was eventually pulled through the portal. What I saw inside was difficult to describe – it looked almost like the inside of a kaleidoscope; with colors changing all around me. I saw a bright light ahead of me and decided to go towards it.

Once I stepped through, I found myself back at the same spot I left; only this time I swear the ground was wet. I was suddenly overwhelmed by a high-pitched whistling noise; overwhelming to the point where I simply collapsed…

…I woke up back in my bedroom, my entire body drenched in sweat. Sitting up in bed, I said to myself, “What the hell was that?"
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: During the Night

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Mom and I set out on our mother/son excursion early the next morning; just after 8:00. After a quick stop at the grocery store to buy some flowers, we went to visit Dad’s grave at the cemetery.

I solemnly placed the flowers on the grave, while Mom stood behind me and said, “You’ll never believe what happened Kyle, but our little boy came back.” Placing a hand on my shoulder, Mom said, “I wish you could’ve lived to see this.”

I was starting to tear up as I gingerly placed my hand on top of mom’s. Looking at the grave, I said, “Mac’s not doing very good
right now, Dad; but I promise that I’ll do everything I can to help her.”

We stayed there for a few minutes before decided it was time to leave; leaving the parking lot just as a funerary procession entered.

************************


A short time later Mom and I were sitting at a little street-side café along the riverfront. We’d been there for about 20 minutes when the waitress came out with our food. I was about to take a bite of my sandwich when Mom said, “You’ve been awfully silent since we left the cemetery; is everything alright?”

“No Mom, everything is far from alright.” Putting my sandwich down, with a sigh, I said, “I just wish that none of this ever happened; that I’d wake up and this would all be some weird dream.”

“Unfortunately, the chances of that happening are quite low, sweetie.” Taking my hand, Mom said, “All you have to do now is keep moving forward and make the best of the situation.”

“My girlfriend dumped me, and my sister is in rehab.” Looking at mom, with the sternest expression I could muster, I said, “How can I possibly make the best of that?”

Mom looked at something behind me and smiled. “I’m afraid there’s nothing I can about your sister, but I might be able to help you with the girlfriend situation.”

Turning around, I was disappointed to see that it wasn’t Emily standing behind me; rather it was Andrea. “Andrea, what are you doing here?”

“Your mom called me this morning; asked if I’d come to talk to you about the situation with Emily.” Taking a seat next to me, Andrea said, “I’ve already heard Emily’s side of the story, now it’s time to hear yours.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Mother & Son Outing

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
“I don’t see what there is for us to talk about; Emily said I was hurting her reputation, so I saved her the trouble and broke up with her.” Seeing the looks that both Mom and Andrea were giving me, I started to feel like I was backed into a corner. Something suddenly occurred to me at the moment; looking at Andrea, I said, “Emily’s not here, is she?”

“Nope.” Shaking her head, Andrea said, “It’s just me.”

“Oh.” As much as I didn’t want to speak with Emily right now, I’d held out hope that she’d come with Andrea. “What exactly did she say about me?”

“Pretty much the same thing you said, although she made you out to be the bad guy.”

“Oh really?” raising an eyebrow, I said, “How so?”

“She said she thought you were being a little pushy.”

“Pushy!?” raising my voice, I said, “I was just giving my girlfriend a kiss; how is that being pushy?”

I suddenly found myself starting to tear up a little while Mom and Andrea tried to comfort me. Looking at me, Mom said, “Calm down honey, you’re making a scene.”

“I don’t care, Mom; after everything I did for Emily when she was little, after learning how much of a crush she had on me – she treated me like I was a liability!”

Looking at me, placing her hand on top of mine, Andrea said, “People sometimes say things they don’t mean.”

“Yeah.” Scoffing, I said, “Like telling someone that you liked them when you really didn’t.”

“That's not what I was talking about.” Getting up and taking a seat next to me, Andrea said, “I don’t think Emily sees you as a liability; even though that’s what she said at the time.”

Wiping my tears with a napkin, I said, “I guess you’re right; I just wish she hadn’t humiliated me in front of all our classmates.”
“That’s another thing; I’m sure she’ll deny it, but after school that day she cried herself to sleep thinking about what she’d done to you.”

“She did?” looking at Andrea, I said, “What’s the point of telling me that if she’d never admit to it?”

“Emily’s a teenage girl, Brian; trust me when I say she’s under a lot of peer pressure at that age.” Looking at me, trying to sound sympathetic, Andrea said, “Just give it some time, I’m sure Emily will come around eventually.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Talking with Andrea

choices: A Few Days Later (Making Progress with Emily)
A Few Days Later (Visiting Mac at Rehab)
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After chatting with Amelia for a little while longer, Mom and I left the café to return home. I was a little surprised when, as we pulled into the driveway, I saw Allison and Cameron sitting on the front porch. I quickly got out of the car and walked up to them, saying, “What are you guys doing here?”

Glancing briefly at Cameron, Allison said, “We thought we’d come check on you; see how you’re doing with everything.” Sighing, she said, “You’ve had a rough week; what with Mac in rehab and your fight with Emily.”

“I appreciate the gesture. But,” Focusing on Allison, I said, “Why are you here? I figured you’d be taking Emily’s side in all this.”

“Hey, just because we’re best friends doesn’t mean I have to agree with her on everything.” Pausing, Allison said, “I happen to think the way she treated you was terrible; she could’ve warned you beforehand, instead of humiliating you like that.”

“It’s just another reminder of just how much things have changed.” Sighing, I said, “One minute I’m teaching her how to ride a bike, the next she’s shoving me to the floor because I tried to kiss her in front of our classmates.”

I then went ahead and told them about my meeting with Andrea; and what she’d said about giving Emily some time. Once I was finished, Cameron said, “I’ll be the first to admit that I know next to nothing about girls; but even I think that’s a smart idea.”

Even though I’d only known them for a short time, I was truly touched by the effort Allison and Cameron were making to check up on me. Looking at them, I said, “Hey, you guys want to come in and watch a movie or something?”

The two of them looked at each other for a moment before Allison smiled and said, “Sure, that sounds like fun.”

As the three of us walked into the house, I turned towards Emily’s house and caught a glimpse of her watching me from her bedroom window. I can only imagine what was going through her mind; seeing her two friends comforting me over her.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: After the Cafe

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
We barely had a chance to sit down before Allison’s phone started to ring. Taking one look at it, she groaned and said, “It’s Emily.”

Looking at Allison, I said, “You don’t have to answer.”

“No, I want to hear what she has to say.” Putting her phone on speaker, Allison said, “What do you want, Emily?”

“Some friend you are, Allison; hanging out with my ex instead of me.” Anger clear in her voice, Emily said, “I can understand Cameron hanging out with him; but you?”

I wanted to speak up, but Allison shushed me, “Just because we’re friends doesn’t mean I have to take your side on everything. I happen to think you’re treating Brian terribly.”

“He embarrassed me in front of the entire school!” her voice getting louder, Emily said, “What else was I supposed to do?”

Allison couldn’t stop me from talking this time, “How was I supposed to know kissing my girlfriend was a big no-no?” leaning closer to the phone, I said, “There are more important things in life then being popular, Em; the sooner you figure that out, the better you’ll be.”

“Please; like you have the faintest idea of what I need.”

Taking her phone back from me, Allison said, “Look Em; I think it’s probably better if we all take a break from each other.” Sighing, she said, “I’ve spent the last 5 years doing everything you and Mac told me to do; I think I need to figure out who I am without you guys.”

“I remember what you were like before Mac and I took you under wings; following us around like some pathetic lost dog.” Her tone turning vile, Emily continued, “You wouldn’t have gotten where you are today if it hadn’t been for us.”

I’d heard enough at that point; but before I could yell at Emily, she ended the call. Cameron and I both stared at Allison, who was clearly on the verge of tears. While Cameron went to hug his sister, I looked at her and said, “Are you okay?”

“I don’t know who that was; but it certainly wasn’t the girl I’ve known for the last 6 years.”

“I know how you feel; I can’t believe how much she and Mac have changed.” Joining in the embrace, I said, “So what happens now?”

“Like I said, I’m going to figure out who I am without Mac and Emily.” Looking at me, Allison said, “Seeing how Emily treated you; I guess that was the kick in the pants I needed.”

“You’re more than welcome to keep hanging out with me; you’ve been nothing but kind to me since I returned. Besides,” sighing, I continued, “perhaps we can figure out where things went wrong for them.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Spending Time with Allison and Cameron

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I really appreciated having Allison and Cameron to hang out with for most of the afternoon, but eventually they had to return home. After saying goodbye to them, I walked into the kitchen for a drink and saw Mom sitting at the kitchen table. “Hey Mom,” pulling up a chair, I said, “what are you doing?”

Gesturing to a pile of mail nearby, Mom said, “Just going through some of the mail.” Turning to me, she said, “Did Allison and Cameron just leave?”

“Yeah, they left a few minutes ago.” Leaning back in the chair, I said, “We spent most of the time trying to figure out how Mac and Emily became so screwed up.”

“Don’t take this the wrong way, but I think your disappearance played a role in that.” Sighing, Mom said, “Your disappearance, and later your father’s death, really effected your sister. As for Emily; she did everything your sister did.”

“So, when Mac developed a mean streak Emily followed suit.” Facing Mom, I said, “You don’t think Emily had a drinking problem, do you?”

Getting up from the chair, Mom said, “No; Emily was stronger than your sister when it came to that.”

Following Mom out into the living room, I said, “I know you and Henry both said I should give Emily some space; but now I’m not so sure.”

I stopped in the doorway as Mom rummaged through a cabinet, retrieving several DVDs and placing them on the table. “What are you doing, Mom?”

Gathering the DVDs, Mom handed them to me and said, “So these to Emily; help her to remember who she used to be.” With a sincere smile, she continued, “Maybe then you can get back the girl you fell in love with.”

With the DVDs in hand, I ran out the door and across the lawn to Emily’s house; the lack of cars in the driveway told me her parents weren’t home. It took her a few moments to respond to my knocking, but eventually she came to the door, “What do you want, Brian?”

“I may not fully understand why you’re so angry with me; but I still love you and deep down I think you still love me.” Pausing, I said, “I was wondering if you’d like to watch some old home movies; from back when being popular was the last thing either of us cared about.”

Looking from me to the DVDs, Emily said...
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later that Day

choices: And I thought my life couldn't get any weirder
11111112.content:
That night I was too wired to go to sleep. I had too many unanswered questions. How had I been asleep for 6 years? Why haven't I aged? When was I going to get out of here? Would they have to run tests on me? Would I be a science experiment? What was everyone going to say?

6 years. That was a lot of birthdays, Christmas', episodes of my favorites shows. Were my shows even still airing. And don't get me started on the school work I missed.

Wait school. I would have to go back to school right? Only all of my friends and classmates wouldn't be there. Because all of my classmates have graduated from high school and started college. My stomach sank with that knowledge. I should be 19 years old. All of my friends were 19 years old. Would they accept me? Would they even want to hang out with a 13 year old.

And what did Mackenzie mean about Eric?
11111112.title: During the Night

1112.content:
Considering the nurse had told me my family was on the way; I was surprised to see a young woman, probably in her early 20s, standing in the doorway. One of the first things I noticed, aside from the Starbucks uniform she was wearing, was that she was rather attractive, “Oh my God, this has to be a dream.” Walking into the room, the woman said, “Brian, is that you?”

My confusion doubled at that point; this woman seemed to know who I was, but I didn’t recall knowing her. I started to wonder if she wandered into the wrong room; but the more I looked at her, the more she started to look familiar. “Do I know you?”

“This is going to sound really strange.” Closing the door, the woman walked over to my bed and said, “Brian; I’m Mackenzie.”

I stared in disbelief at the woman; as I was quite sure what she said wasn’t possible. “Is this some kind of joke?” looking at her, I said, “I don’t know who you are, but you’re not Mackenzie. She’s only 7 years old.”

“This isn’t a joke, Brian; I’m telling you the truth.” Pulling one of the chairs next to the bed, the woman said, “I really am Mackenzie.”

As much as I wanted to believe the woman was messing with me; I couldn’t shake the feeling that she was telling the truth. The woman had the same goofy smile that Mackenzie had, and she even sounded a bit like her. “If you really are Mackenzie; then tell me something that only she would know.”

“Are you seriously asking me that?” looking at me, an annoyed look appearing on her face, the woman said, “Why would I lie about being your sister?”

“How would I know!” looking at her, I said, “Just answer the question.”

“Okay, fine.” Sighing, Mackenzie said, “When you were 11 years old, you were moving some boxes into the attic. The bottom came out on one of them, and about a dozen issues of Playboy spilled out onto the hallway floor. You made me promise never to tell Mom and Dad.”

My eyes widened as soon as I heard her mention the Playboys. I had hidden them inside a box of old books I was bringing into the attic. I must’ve overloaded the box because the bottom fell out just as I passed by Mackenzie’s room. There was no denying it any longer. “Mac? Is that really you?”

Leaning over to hug me, Mackenzie said, “It’s really me, big brother.”

The two of us hugged for a moment; which didn’t help my discomfort in any way. Once we stopped hugging, I subtly moved around in order to hide my unfortunate erection. Looking at her, I said, “I’m not exactly your big brother anymore, Mac; I mean you’re like 10 years older than me now.”

“Good guess, Brian; I’ll actually be 22 next month.”

“You’re 21 years old?” trying to do the math in my head, I said, “That means I’ve been missing for...”

“You’ve been missing for close to 15 years.”
1112.title: A Young Woman

11121.content:
“15 years!?” in shock, I said, “How could be possible?”

“I have no idea.” Looking at me, Mackenzie said, “The last time I saw you; we were playing hide and seek in the woods behind the house. When you didn’t find me after 30 minutes, I got worried and ran back to call Mom.”

“I can probably guess what happened next; the police searched the area but found nothing.”

“They called off the search after about two months; which proved to be too much for Dad.” Sighing, Mackenzie said, “He died three months after you disappeared.”

Those words hit me like a punch to the stomach. I knew Dad was sick, but I still held out hope that he would’ve made a miraculous recovery. But the fact that he died, and I missed it, was too much for me to handle. Tears trickling down my face, I said, “Dad.....died.”

“It was quick if that makes you feel any better.” Looking at me, tearing up herself, Mackenzie said, “He wanted nothing more than to see you again.”

Wiping tears from my eyes, I said, “I-I’m sorry I wasn’t there for you, Mac.”

“You have nothing to be sorry about, Brian.” Sighing, Mackenzie grasped my hand in hers, “You disappeared to god knows where; you couldn’t have known.”

“Still; it must’ve been rough for you, with me disappearing and then Dad dying.” Looking at her, I said, “How’d Mom take it?”

“About as well as you’d expect; she, uh, was an emotional wreck for a while. Eventually, she realized she had to pull herself together for me.” Pausing, Mackenzie said, “We were all each other had; until Henry came into the picture.”

“Henry?” confused, I said, “Whose Henry?”

“Henry is Mom’s second husband.”
11121.title: 15 Years!?

111211.content:
Come to find out, Mom remarried a few years after Dad died. By all accounts Henry was a great guy; Mac spoke highly of him. After a while Mac and I found we were unable to think of anything more to talk about; odd considering I’d missed the last 15 years. I was lying in bed, while Mac helped herself to a fruit cup from my dinner tray, when I said, “Why are you here instead of Mom?”

“Mom and Henry in Massachusetts bringing Aaron back from Scout Camp. They'll be here first thing in the morning.” Seeing the quizzical look on my face, Mackenzie said, “Oh right; I suppose I should’ve mentioned that Mom and Henry had a son. Aaron’s our 9-year-old half-brother.”

Considering I’d been missing for 15 years, I shouldn’t have been surprised to hear that I had a younger brother. “Okay, I don’t want any more surprises.” Looking at Mackenzie, I said, “Just tell me everything I’ve missed over the last 15 years.”
111211.title: Continue

1112111.content:
“Oh boy, what haven’t you missed?” sitting back in her chair, Mackenzie said, “Collin got married a few months back; her name is Andrea, I think you’d like her.”

“What about Carrie?”
